summary: The latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team.

show.name: Breakfast
show.summary: The latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team.

summary: Interviews with key newsmakers and cultural figures. Andrew's guests include Benjamin Netanyahu, Amber Rudd MP, Dawn Butler MP, Olivia Colman and Michelle Pfeiffer.

show.name: The Andrew Marr Show
show.summary: Presenter Andrew Marr talks to invited guests from politics, broadcasting and the arts to review the week's events making the news, and discuss the headlines in the Sunday newspapers.

summary: Richard T Pallot presents the latest headlines from around the world.

show.name: ITV Weekend News and Weather
show.summary: The latest headlines from around the world. Followed by national and local weather forecasts.

name: Paul Hollywood, Scarlett Moffatt, Gareth Malone, Sian Gibson, Johnny Vegas, Jon Ronson, First Aid Kit
summary: Tim Lovejoy and Simon Rimmer host the Sunday show with recipes and previews. Guests include Paul Hollywood, who talks about The Great British Bake Off and his new book A Baker's Life: 100 Fantastic Recipes, from Childhood Bakes to Five-Star Excellence. Sian Gibson and Johnny Vegas chat about TV comedy drama Murder on the Blackpool Express, Jon Ronson discusses his tour Psychopath Night, and there's music from First Aid Kit performing It's a Shame.

show.name: Sunday Brunch
show.summary: Tim Lovejoy and Simon Rimmer host Sunday Brunch, packed with celebrity guests, tasty cookery and chat.

name: Quarter-Final 2: Glenfrome v Stone
summary: Susan Calman asks the questions as the search for the UK's smartest school steps up to the next stage. In this quarter-final Glenfrome from Bristol take on Stone from Buckinghamshire. Will one of them go on to be Top Class?

show.name: Top Class
show.summary: Susan Calman hosts this brand new competitive knock-out series which pits schools from the length and breadth of the UK against each other as they answer questions designed to test them to their limits.

name: Episode 20
summary: Is there a 'witch hunt' over harassment? Sean Fletcher and Emma Barnett discuss. Plus Naomie Harris talks about a new scheme for the homeless and Benjamin Zephaniah on Tai Chi.

show.name: Sunday Morning Live
show.summary: Sunday Morning Live is a topical debate show presented by Naga Muchetty. She will explore the big ethical talking points of the week with invited guests.

name: Episode 7
summary: Bank of England governor Mark Carney discusses the recent interest rate rise with Robert Peston. Other guests include transport secretary Chris Grayling and presenter Eddie Mair.

show.name: Peston on Sunday
show.summary:
This brand new live current affairs programme hosted by ITV News political editor Robert Peston sets out to offer viewers a fresh and lively approach to politics every Sunday.

Providing a distinctive perspective on the major stories of the day, Peston on Sunday will feature in-depth interviews with guests from across the political spectrum as well as figures from across the cultural landscape.

The programme will also offer live viewer engagement, led by presenter Allegra Stratton whose interactive screen will provide a portal into reaction on social media as well as the latest talking points from the political blogosphere and beyond.

summary: Sarah Smith and Tim Donovan with the latest political news, interviews and debate. Guests include shadow defence secretary Nia Griffith, George Galloway and Peter Hitchens.

show.name: Sunday Politics
show.summary: Andrew Neil presents the latest political news and interviews with regional opt-outs.

summary: Mark Chapman and guests analyse Saturday's Premier League matches and look ahead to Sunday's four games, which include a heavyweight encounter at the Etihad between Manchester City and Arsenal and Chelsea's crucial clash against Manchester United.

show.name: MOTD2 Extra
show.summary: Extended discussion and coverage of Saturday's premier league games, hosted by Mark Chapman.

summary: Richard T Pallot presents the latest headlines from around the world.

show.name: ITV Weekend News and Weather
show.summary: The latest headlines from around the world. Followed by national and local weather forecasts.

summary: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

show.name: BBC Weekend News
show.summary: BBC Weekend News is the national news programmes on BBC One at a weekend although it is often referred to on guides simply as BBC News, or if broadcast at 10pm exactly, BBC News at Ten. The programmes are also simulcast on the BBC News Channel.

name: Episode 20
summary: Jeremy Vine presents audience views on BBC TV over the week.

show.name: Points of View
show.summary: Jeremy Vine puts programme makers in the hot seat to respond to viewer complaints.

name: Episode 12
summary: Jason Mohammad presents reports, goals and results with Dion Dublin and Leicester City assistant manager Michael Appleton.

show.name: Final Score
show.summary: Final Score provides the latest football results as they come in, covering the Premiership, Football League, Non-League and Scottish League's.

name: Milton Keynes
summary: Sean Fletcher visits Milton Keynes as it celebrates its fiftieth anniversary, and he has a kick-about with freestyle footballer Daniel Cutting.

show.name: Songs of Praise
show.summary: Songs of Praise is a BBC Television religious programme that presents Christian hymns which first aired in October 1961. The first edition was broadcast from the Tabernacle Baptist Church in Cardiff, and the series is one of the longest-running of its kind on television anywhere in the world.

summary: Channel 4 News, includes sport and weather.

show.name: Channel 4 News
show.summary: The latest news, sport and weather presented primarily by Jon Snow.

summary: The latest national and international news stories from the BBC News team.

show.name: BBC Weekend News
show.summary: BBC Weekend News is the national news programmes on BBC One at a weekend although it is often referred to on guides simply as BBC News, or if broadcast at 10pm exactly, BBC News at Ten. The programmes are also simulcast on the BBC News Channel.

summary: The latest headlines from around the world. Followed by a national forecast.

show.name: ITV Weekend News and Weather
show.summary: The latest headlines from around the world. Followed by national and local weather forecasts.

name: Offshore Secrets of the Rich Exposed
summary: A special edition investigating a huge new leak of data that reveals how the wealthy and powerful invest offshore.

show.name: Panorama
show.summary: Panorama is a current affairs programme, featuring interviews and investigative reports on a wide variety of subjects.

name: Dion Dublin, Lesley Garrett, Hannah Mills, Chris Ramsey
summary: In today's show, ex footballer and TV Presenter Dion Dublin, singer Lesley Garrett, Olympic Gold Medalist Hannah Mills and comedian Chris Ramsey come together to work as a team in the hope of winning thousands of pounds for their charities. But just who will they be up against?

show.name: The Chase: Celebrity Special
show.summary:
The Chase: Celebrity Special is a spin-off of the original The Chase featuring celebrity teams as contestants.

Unlike the regular version, which is broadcast daily, the celebrity version is broadcast weekly. As with the daily show, the spin-off is hosted by Walsh and features the same Chasers (Labbett, Wallace, Hegerty, Sinha and Ryan). The game is played exactly the same as the regular version. However, if all four celebrities have been caught by the Chaser, the prize fund during the Final Chase is £20,000. If the team is caught during the Final Chase, a consolation prize of £1,000 is awarded to the charities for each celebrity who advanced to the Final Chase.

name: Autumn Special
summary: Matt Baker crunches through the leaves to find out about a new charter to protect woodlands, and Ellie Harrison meets Skomer's new seal pups.

show.name: Countryfile
show.summary: The people, places and stories making news in the British countryside.

show.name: Robot Wars
show.summary: 40 teams of amateur robot fighting enthusiasts battle it out over a series of rounds in a huge purpose-built arena aiming to become the Robot Wars Champion.

name: Arctic
summary: A team of expert engineers are abandoned in Arctic conditions in a simulated crash site, with the leftovers of a light aircraft and two snow mobiles. Their only chance of escape is to create a vehicle from the wreckage. Ex-Special Forces soldier and survival expert Ant Middleton oversees the team of three men and two women, who each bring a specific skill to the team - from aircraft mechanics to vehicle engineering. But as the freezing conditions close in, debilitating the group, the engineers are unable to agree on what to construct, and increasingly escape looks unlikely.

show.name: Escape
show.summary: Dropped in the middle of hostile terrain, five people have only one way to survive - build a machine from wreckage and get out of there. Will they do it in time?

show.name: James and Jupp
show.summary: Comedians Elis James and Miles Jupp take a series of unconventional trips around Wales.

name: Live Show 4
summary:
The nation's favourite singing show continues this weekend with the anticipated live rounds. Hosted by Dermot O'Leary.

Each of the final 16 contestants will sing their hearts out on the live stage with judges Louis Walsh, Sharon Osbourne, Nicole Scherzinger and Simon Cowell resuming their seats behind the judges' desk to battle it out with their contestants in the hope of impressing the audience at home.

show.name: The X Factor
show.summary:
Thousands audition. Only one can win. The search is on for the next singing Superstar.

The X Factor is a talent show in which the participants have to audition before a jury.

name: Week 7 Results
summary:
The time has come for another dancing duo to leave the competition, as Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman reveal which two couples face this week's dance-off in the results show.

This weekend's musical performance comes from Welsh rock band Stereophonics and the judges will once again be putting the routines from the night before under the microscope.

show.name: Strictly Come Dancing
show.summary: Are today's celebrities fleet of foot or do they have two left feet? That's the question Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman will be finding the answer to when they present Strictly Come Dancing.

name: The Deep
summary: The Deep takes us on an epic journey into the unknown, a world of crushing pressure, brutal cold and utter darkness. It's the largest living space on our planet, and today, scientists think there's more life here than anywhere else on Earth. This is our final frontier.

show.name: Blue Planet II
show.summary: Wildlife documentary series, presented and narrated by David Attenborough, exploring the planet's oceans.

name: Marne-Rhine Canal
summary: Timothy West and Prunella Scales set off on their adventure along the French canal system, as they travel down the Marne-Rhine Canal in Alsace and Lorraine, close to the German border. Their journey takes in enchanted forests and fairy-tale castles; mountains and valleys; the baffling French lock system; local wines; and a visit to Strasbourg and the European Parliament.

show.name: Great Canal Journeys
show.summary: Timothy West and Prunella Scales embark on spectacular canal journeys across Britain and abroad.

name: The Bigger Picture
summary: Joe's future in the army hangs in the balance. Armstrong fears for Yusra's safety. Honor is devastated by Joe's secret past. Markham struggles between duty and his own moral compass.

show.name: The Last Post
show.summary:
Set in the mid-Sixties in the shimmering heat of Aden, Yemen, The Last Post centres on a unit of Royal Military Police officers and their families. Their job is two-fold: half soldiers and half policemen who face constant insurgency and threat. Danger is everywhere. Hand grenades, mines and sniper attacks are a constant threat.

As the insurgency takes a real hold and casualties mount it becomes harder for everyone not to start to ask the big questions. What are we doing here? Is it right? As the old established order of the Fifties comes apart who will survive and who will flounder?

show.name: Louis Theroux
show.summary: The documentary work of British-American journalist Louis Theroux.

name: The Moors Murders - Howard Linskey
summary: Simon Toyne travels north to investigate one of the most chilling partnerships of all time, the crimes committed by Ian Brady and Myra Hindley.

show.name: Written in Blood
show.summary: Crime novelist Simon Toyne investigates some of the darkest real-life crime stories which have inspired pieces of crime fiction.

name: Episode 17
summary: Reality series following a group of buff boys and glamorous girls from Essex. What have the gang been up to this week?

show.name: The Only Way is Essex
show.summary: Reality series which follows a group of friends living their day-to-day lives in Essex.

summary: The latest headlines from around the world. Followed by national and local weather forecasts.

show.name: ITV Weekend News and Weather
show.summary: The latest headlines from around the world. Followed by national and local weather forecasts.

summary: The latest national and international news, with reports from BBC correspondents worldwide.

show.name: BBC Weekend News
show.summary: BBC Weekend News is the national news programmes on BBC One at a weekend although it is often referred to on guides simply as BBC News, or if broadcast at 10pm exactly, BBC News at Ten. The programmes are also simulcast on the BBC News Channel.

name: North East: Likely Lads
summary: Police are on high alert as rival football fans gather at Sunderland's Stadium of Light, while drunks turn violent after being thrown out of a club.

show.name: The Force
show.summary: The cameras follow the 999 work of Greater Manchester Police who are England's second largest police force and are responsible for protecting 2.7 million people.
